posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Hello Fairy Master,
If you take half-elf, you must take WP Martial to get bow proficiency with the two classes you have chosen. Elves get racial proficiency with bows.
You can avoid the xp penalty with elf, just like Stagmeister says, with either taking equal amounts of Bard and Cleric or by taking Wizard instead of Bard.
It all boils down to what build you want.
I usually try to take a moderate amount of strength, up to 14 if I can afford it, to add to damage. You can add to strength later with items or potions when you get higher mighty properties.
A high number of AA levels will make your archer better with higher AB and better damage.
When building an archer with Cleric, I aim at 15 Cleric levels to max out most buffs. If you take 14-16 Bard levels as well to avoid an xp penalty, you get a build that matures late, and you don't get much from only about 10 levels of AA.
I have to admit that most things with Cleric 15 or Bard 14-16 will be a strong build, but more AA will make a better archer.
